Welcome to Phone Book’s documentation!¶

Phone Book main¶

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

This function checks the health of the database connection by executing a test query.

Parameters:

db (AsyncSession) – An async database connection.

Returns:

A dictionary with a message indicating the health status of the database connection.

Raises:

HTTPException 500 – If there is an error connecting to the database or the database is not configured correctly.

main.root()¶

Root endpoint that returns a welcome message. :param: None :return: A dictionary with a welcome message. :rtype: dict

async main.startup()¶

This function is an event handler that runs when the FastAPI application starts up. It initializes a connection to a Redis server and initializes a FastAPILimiter instance.

Param:

None

Returns:

None

Raises:

None

Phone Book repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶

Creates a new contact for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactSchema) – The data for the contact to create.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The async database session.

  • current_user (User) – The user to create the contact for.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶

Removes a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to remove.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The async database session.

  • current_user (User) – The user to remove the contact for.

Returns:

The removed contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_birthday_contacts(days: int, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶

Returns a list of contact(-s) who has birthday within specified range of days for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • days (int) – The number of days that define the range.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The async database session.

  • current_user (User) – The user to show the contact(-s) for.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The async database session.

  • current_user (User) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

Returns:

The contact with the specified ID, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • offset (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The async database session.

  • current_user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(search: str, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶

Searches of a contact by fields ‘name’, ‘lastname’ or ‘email’ for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • search (str) – The field with information for search the contact.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The async database session.

  • current_user (User) – The user to search the contact for.

Returns:

The contact that matches the search, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdateSchema, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶

Updates a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactUpdateSchema) – The updated data for the contact.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The async database session.

  • current_user (User) – The user to update the contact for.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.update_status_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactStatusUpdate, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶

Updates the status (i.e. “favourite” or “not favourite”) of a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactStatusUpdate) – The updated status for the contact.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The async database session.

  • current_user (User) – The user to update the contact for.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

  • email (str) – User’s email.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Asynchronous session object of the database.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Asynchronous session object of the database.

Returns:

  • email (str) – User’s email.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Asynchronous session object of the database.

Returns:

User object from the database.

User

Updates a user’s avatar URL.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – User’s email.

  • url (str | None) – New user avatar URL.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Asynchronous session object of the database.

Returns:

Updated user object.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

Updates a user’s token.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – User object.

  • token (str | None) – New user token.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Asynchronous session object of the database.

Phone Book routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Creates a new contact for the authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactSchema) – The data for the new contact.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Deletes a specific contact by its ID for the authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete. Must be greater than or equal to 1.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The deleted contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.routes.contacts.get_birthday_contacts(days: int = Query(7), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieves a list of contacts with birthdays within the next specified number of days for the authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • days (int) – The number of days in the future to search for birthdays. Must be greater than or equal to 1. Defaults to 7.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

A list of contacts with birthdays within the specified number of days.

Return type:

list[Contact]

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieves a specific contact by its ID for the authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve. Must be greater than or equal to 1.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found.

Returns:

The contact with the specified ID.

Return type:

Contact

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for the authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return. Must be between 10 and 500. Defaults to 10.

  • offset (int) – The number of contacts to skip before starting to collect the result set. Must be greater than or equal to 0. Defaults to 0.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

list

async src.routes.contacts.search_contacts(search: str = Query(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Searches for contacts by a search query for the authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • search (str) – The search query. Must have a minimum length of 1.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the search query.

Return type:

list[Contact]

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactUpdateSchema, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Updates a specific contact by its ID for the authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactUpdateSchema) – The updated data for the contact.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update. Must be greater than or equal to 1.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found.

Returns:

The updated contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.routes.contacts.update_status_contact(body: ContactStatusUpdate, contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Updates the status of a specific contact by its ID for the authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactStatusUpdate) – The updated status data for the contact.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update the status.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found.

Returns:

The updated contact with the new status.

Return type:

Contact

Changing avatar for current user

Parameters:

  • current_user (User) – User that currently login

  • db (AsyncSession) – Asynchronous session object of the database.

Returns:

User object from the database.

Return type:

User

current_user (User) – User that currently login

Phone Book routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Confirms a user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The confirmation token.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the user does not exist or the email is already confirmed.

Returns:

A dictionary containing a message indicating the result of the operation.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Logs in an existing user.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – The login credentials.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the user email is invalid, the email is not confirmed, or the password is invalid.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the access token, refresh token, and token type.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Depends(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Refreshes the access token for an authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – The refresh token credentials.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the refresh token is invalid.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the new access token, refresh token, and token type.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Requests the confirmation of a user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – The request body containing the user’s email.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – The background tasks to be executed.

  • request (Request) – The request object.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the user does not exist or the email is already confirmed.

Returns:

A dictionary containing a message indicating the result of the operation.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserSchema, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Signs up a new user

Parameters:

  • body (UserSchema) – The user data to be signed up.

  • bt (BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks to be executed.

  • request (Request) – The request object.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the user account already exists.

Returns:

The newly created user.

Return type:

User

Phone Book service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

Class for authentication-related operations.

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = '6b57c08e4a419e6bbce6a34a86fe306f54edc2cd21c67d3f7c5a5a791b5bcaf7'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Creates an access token for a user with a specified expiration time.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The data to be encoded in the token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – The expiration time of the token.

Returns:

The encoded access token.

Return type:

str

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

Creates an email token.

Parameters:

data (dict) – The data to include in the token.

Returns:

The encoded email token.

Return type:

str

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Creates a refresh token for a user with a specified expiration time.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The data to be encoded in the token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – The expiration time of the token.

Returns:

The encoded refresh token.

Return type:

str

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

Decodes a refresh token and returns the email associated with it.

Parameters:

refresh_token (str) – The refresh token to be decoded.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the refresh token is invalid.

Returns:

The email of the user associated with the refresh token.

Return type:

str

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Gets the current user from the access token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The access token.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid.

Returns:

The current user.

Return type:

User

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

Gets the email from an email token.

Parameters:

token (str) – The email token to decode.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid.

Returns:

The email from the token.

Return type:

str

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

Hashes a password using bcrypt algorithm.

Parameters:

password (str) – The password to be hashed.

Returns:

The hashed password.

Return type:

str

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

Verifies a password using bcrypt algorithm.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – The password to be verified.

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password to be compared.

Returns:

True if the password is correct, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

Phone Book service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Sends email to user with link for verification

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – email of user

  • username (str) – username of user

  • host (str) – host of app

Raises:

ConnectionErrors – error in sending email to user
